(1912- August 11, 2000) bụ onye Africa-America na-ese ihe, ónyé na-ese onyinyo na onye na-anakọta ihe
McBride malitere ọrụ ya n'afọ ndị 1930 n'etiti ndị na-ese ihe ojii na ohere nka nke Works Progress Administration nyere
Ọ ga-emecha hapụ akara ya na Chicago dị ka ihe na-akpali South Side Community Art Center
McBride gosipụtara onwe ya dị ka ónyé nkụzi, dị ka ónyé na-ahụ màkà ọdịbendị na ndọrọ ndọrọ ọchịchị, yana dị ka onye nchịkọta nka na nka Africa site n'aka ndị na-ese ihe ojii nke ọgbọ ya.
na 1912 na Algiers, New Orleans. Ọ bụ nwá nke abụọ n'ime ụmụ atọ nke William na Mary McBride
Mgbè ọ dị ihe dị ka afọ iri, ọ sonyeere ihe a na-akpọ Great Migration of African Americans ka ya na ezinụlọ ya kwagara South Side nké Chicago, ebe ọ gara ụlọ akwụkwọ grammar St
Elizabeth na Wendell Phillips High School. McBride nwụrụ na August 11, 2000 na Alden Princeton Rehabilitation Center na Chicago, mgbè ọ dị afọ 87.
Na mbido ndụ ya, McBride nwere mmasị na nka anya

Na mbido afọ 1930, ọ gàrà klas na School of the Art Institute of Chicago, ọ gàrà n'ihu sonye n'òtù ndị na-eto eto na-ese ihe ojii a maara dị ka Arts and Crafts Guild. Ọ bụ George Neal guzobere guild ahụ n'oge Great Depression, ndị otu ya na-ezukọ mgbe niile iji kesaa usoro na nkà, kwurịta nka na ndọrọ ndọrọ ọchịchị, ma nweta ego màkà ihe ngosi nke ha na ọrụ nka.

"Only in Crowd: Prints of the 1930s and 1940s by African-American Artists From the Collection of Reba and Dave Williams"  ngosi nke American Federation of Arts haziri ma kesaa, meghere na Newark Museum, N.J
[citation needed]African American Designers in Chicago: Art, Commerce, and the Politics of Race Exhibitions, Chicago Department of Cultural Affairs & Special Events, October 27, 2018 ːz March 3, 2019
